boat.name: La Louve
boat.full_description:
'La Louve' is a superb little cutter built in Carantec by Sibril in 1963. She has been maintained in superb condition, including some excellent restoration work over the years.

Jean Yvon Combot, owner in 2013, her 50th birthday year, joined in the OGA50 celebrations at Cowes.

In an article published on 'Sailing by' he reflects on the event and his passage to the Isle of Wight. 'Gwen Bleiz' sailed in company with five other French OGA members, and returned via Guernsey. Jean Yvon writes in French, and we have included an English translation.

She changed hands in 2018.
boat.short_description: Built by Sibiril of Carantec in 1963, 'La Louve', formerly 'Gwen-Bleiz' is described as 'a superb little cutter', celebrating her 50th birthday by joining the OGA Anniversary party in Cowes, August 2013.
